result.execSummary:
The defendant Tyler D Stephan was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • False Imprisonment, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.30.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

of the 3/20/15 Plea and Sentencing Hearing held before the Honorable Judge Sarah O'Brien

Case called at 9:42 am [Clerk SH]
Defendant Tyler D Stephan in court, in-custody, with Attorney Elizabeth F. Svehlek. ADA Jeffrey Martin Shock appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Sentencing Arguments by Counsel

On Count #2, the Court sentences Mr. Stephan to 4 years, with an Initial Term of Confinement in Prison of 2 years and the maximum time to serve on Extended Supervision of 2 years.  This sentence is to commence consecitive to any previously imposed sentence

The Court finds that the Defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program (Boot Camp) and the Substance Abuse Program. 
The Court gives 147 days credit for time already served.

The Court orders as conditions of Extended Supervision:
--No contact with Stephanie Heiden unless she and agent agree. Contact punishable under Wis. Stat. 973.049 & 941.39
--AODA Assessment & Follow Through with any recommended treatment, per Agent
--To undergo any other assessment, treatment or counseling as required per Agent
--to undergo mental health assessment and follow through with recommended treatment 
--to take all prescribed medications as prescribed 
--to undergo anger management 
--to maintain absolute sobriety 
--No presence in bars, taverns or liquor stores
--No possession or consumption of alcohol
--No possession or consumption of controlled substances without a valid prescription
--To obtain/maintain employment and/or education program or combination of the two, per Agent
--DNA Sample and surcharge 
--To pay remaining financial obligations
Court recommends DOC provide mental health treatment and placement at the Resource Center

Felony Firearm and Voting-rights prohibitions/warnings given
Explanation of Determinate Sentence form given to the Defendant
Recess: 10:07 am
Defendant from Milwaukee Secure Detention Facility for the 10/15/15 SEHR // Certified copy provided to the DA's Office
Proposed Order to Produce defendant for 10/15/15
Attorney Elizabeth Svehlek
Sentencing hearing on revocation at 10-15-2015 09:30 am

Case called at 10:22am [mo]
Reserve Judge Sarah O'Brien presiding for Branch IV
Defendant Tyler D Stephan in court with attorney Elizabeth F. Svehlek.  Susan Victoria Happ appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Constitutional rights given; plea of "No Contest" entered on Count #2; factual basis given; victim rights compliance verified; Court finds the plea has been entered freely, voluntarily, intelligently and accepts the plea, finds Defendant guilty, and orders JOC entered.
On Motion of the State, the Court reads-in and dismisses Count #1,3 & 4

Sentencing Arguments given by Counsel 

On Count #2, the Court withholds sentence, places Defendant on Probation for 2.5 years, with conditions:
--to serve 30 days in Jefferson County Jail, with Huber/Work-release privileges; Imposed and Stayed   
--No contact with Stephanie Heiden unless she and agent agree. Contact punishable under Wis. Stat. 973.049 & 941.39
--AODA Assessment & Follow Through with any recommended treatment, per Agent
--To undergo any other assessment, treatment or counseling as required per Agent
--to undergo mental health assessment and follow through with recommended treatment 
--to take all prescribed medications as prescribed 
--to undergo anger management 
--to maintain absolute sobriety 
--No presence in bars, taverns or liquor stores
--No possession or consumption of alcohol
--No possession or consumption of controlled substances without a valid prescription
--To obtain/maintain employment and/or education program or combination of the two, per Agent
--DNA Sample and surcharge 
--To pay costs

Court presents basis and denies expungement upon sucessful completion of probation
Apply cash bond to costs 


Days credit for time already served: 5 days
Felony Firearm/Voting Prohibitions Warnings Form Given
recess: 10:44am
Status conference on March 20, 2015 at 10:00 am.
Pre-trial conference on March 4, 2015 at 09:20 am.
Scheduling notice

Case called 10:28am[MO]
Defendant Tyler D Stephan in court with attorney Elizabeth F. Svehlek.   ADA Monica Hall appears for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty. Svehlek requests an additional Pretrial Conference. She indicates the case has not been neglected, an investigator has been doing work on the case. 
The Court reminds Counsel that if a resolution does not come out of these proceedings, a FSSC and Jury Trial will be set. 
The Court and Counsel discuss scheduling.
The Court reminds Mr. Stephan that his bond and its conditions remain in effect for the duration of the case.
Recess: 10:29am

original bond document received from JESO on 11/14/14
Scheduling notice

Case called at 1:44 pm
Defendant Tyler D Stephan in custody, via video from the Jefferson County Jail with Attorney Jeffrey De La Rosa from the Jefferson County Public Defenders Office (PD will appoint counsel). Public Service Special Prosecutor Melanie Flint appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Court verifies with the defendant that the DOB and address listed on the criminal complaint are correct.
Service of Complaint admitted; reading waived; felony charges and maximum penalties recited; reading of misdemeanor charge and maximum penalties waived.
Court finds that the criminal complaint states probable cause to support Count #1 - #4.
Bail/Bond recommendations presented by counsel.

Court requires $500.00 CASH bond, with conditions:  
-No acts or threats of violence 
-Not to possess any dangerous weapons
-No contact with Stephanie Heiden or her residence

Court will schedule Preliminary Hearing within 20 day time limit. 
Upon stipulation, the Court finds the video connection to be sight and sound sufficient. 

Recess: 1:54 pm
NEXT: (Notices to be mailed)
Preliminary Hearing: 11/24/14 at 8:30 am
